intro: Trigonella gaillardotii, commonly known as the Gaillardot's fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to wetland environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
